references.title: In addition to TRAC in the Transvaal there were AFRA (Association for Rural Advancement) in Natal; ANCRA (Association for Northern Cape Rural Advancement) in Northern Cape; SCLC (Southern Cape Land Committee) in Southern Cape;
references.raw: In addition to TRAC in the Transvaal there were AFRA (Association for Rural Advancement) in Natal;  ANCRA (Association for Northern Cape Rural Advancement) in Northern Cape; SCLC  (Southern Cape Land Committee) in Southern Cape; BRC (Border Rural Committee), ECLC (Eastern Cape Land Committee) and TLSO (Transkei Land Service Organisation) in Eastern Cape; FSRC (Free State Rural Committee) in the Free State; and FRRP (Farmworkers Research and Resource Project).  Names are those of the former provinces, or smaller divisions of provinces, in pre-1994 South Africa.  See James (2000) for a fuller account of TRAC’s involvement. For a summary of the restitution of Doornkop, see TRAC Newsletter No.30, 1995, and Winburg and Weinburg (1996).

references.title: This farm is not the only Doornkop to have been confiscated during the apartheid regime and restituted in the new South Africa. Doornkop near Ventersdorp in the Transvaal was restored to its former owners in 1995. See report by Evidence wa ka Ngobeni
references.raw: This farm is not the only Doornkop to have been confiscated during the apartheid regime and restituted in the new South Africa.  Doornkop near Ventersdorp in the Transvaal was restored to its former owners in 1995.  See report by Evidence wa ka Ngobeni in The Mail and Guardian, June 23, 1999: “Twenty years after the Doornkop community’s land was given to white farmers, the commission on land restitution restored their ownership”.
